snippet.textDisplay:
On this day in history, On 19 May 1904 *The Great Businessman Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata passed away.* .

He was born on 3 March 1839
 Navsari, British India
 (now in Gujarat, India).

*Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata* was an Indian pioneer industrialist who *founded Tata Steel and the Tata Group,* India's biggest conglomerate company. Named the greatest philanthropist of the last century by several polls and ranking lists, he also *established the city of Jamshedpur.*

*Jamshedji Tata is regarded* as *the legendary "Father of Indian Industry".* 
He was so influential in the world of industry that *Jawaharlal Nehru referred to Tata as a One-Man Planning Commission.*

*Former PM Nehru's Words* for Jamsetji Nusserwanji Tata

*"When you have to give the lead in action, in ideas – a lead which does not fit in with the very climate of opinion – that is true courage, physical or mental or spiritual, call it what you like, and it is this type of courage and vision that Jamshedji Tata showed. It is right that we should honour his memory and remember him as one of the big founders of modern India."*
*—Jawaharlal Nehru*

*Jai Hind*
*Hindustan Jindabad*
🌹💞🥰🙏🇮🇳🇮🇳🙏🥰💞🌹
